meanings.definition: A system of government by the whole population or all the eligible members of a state, typically through elected representatives.
meanings.sent1: In a democracy, everyone gets to vote for their leaders.
meanings.sent2: The United States is a democracy where people choose their leaders through elections.
meanings.sent3: The penguins held a democracy to decide who gets the last fish.
meanings.sent4: Her classroom was a democracy, with the teacher as the elected leader.
meanings.sent5: The concept of democracy ensures that every voice is heard in decision-making.

meanings.definition: Control of an organization or group by the majority of its members.
meanings.sent1: The democracy of the club allowed the members to make decisions together.
meanings.sent2: The democracy in the company ensured that decisions were made collectively.
meanings.sent3: The democracy of the ants led to a chaotic picnic.
meanings.sent4: The democracy of the forest animals was evident in their shared decision-making.
meanings.sent5: The democracy within the team fostered a sense of unity and collaboration.

meanings.definition: A state governed by a democracy.
meanings.sent1: The country was proud to be a democracy where people had a say in governance.
meanings.sent2: Living in a democracy meant that citizens had a role in shaping policies.
meanings.sent3: The democracy of the land of sweets was ruled by the Candy Council.
meanings.sent4: In the democracy of the magical realm, wizards and witches voted on laws.
meanings.sent5: The democracy of the island nation ensured freedom and equality for all.
